docs.title: Welcome to maeson
docs.text:
Geospatial software for raster and point cloud processing.

Sure! Here's the homepage.md in proper Markdown format:

docs.title: Welcome to MAESon 🌍🤖
docs.text: MAESon (Machine Learning and Artificial Intelligence for Earth Science) is an open-source geospatial software package that harnesses the power of AI and machine learning to analyze Earth science data. Whether you're working with remote sensing imagery, hydrological models, or ecological datasets, MAESon provides cutting-edge tools to extract meaningful insights.

docs.title: Why MAESon? 🚀
docs.text:
• AI-Powered Geospatial Analysis: Integrates machine learning models for classification, prediction, and feature extraction.
  • Remote Sensing Support: Works with multispectral, hyperspectral, and LiDAR data.
  • Hydrological & Ecological Tools: Analyze land cover, water bodies, and vegetation changes.
  • Seamless GIS Integration: Compatible with GDAL, QGIS, and other geospatial tools.
  • Open-Source & Community-Driven: Built for researchers, by researchers.

docs.title: Getting Started 💡
docs.text: Ready to dive in? Follow these steps to set up MAESon on your machine:

docs.title: 1. Install MAESon
docs.text: pip install maeson

docs.title: 2. Load Your Data
docs.text:
import maeson
data = maeson.load_raster("path/to/your/data.tif")

docs.title: 3. Run Analysis
docs.text: result = maeson.process_raster(data, model="random_forest")

docs.title: Learn More 📚
docs.text:
• Installation Guide – Step-by-step setup instructions.
  • User Guide – Explore core functionalities and examples.
  • API Reference – Detailed documentation on available methods.
  • Contributing – Join the MAESon development community!

docs.title: Stay Connected 💬
docs.text:
• GitHub: github.com/yourusername/MAESon
  • Discussions & Issues: Submit questions, feature requests, or bug reports.
  • Community Contributions: Help improve MAESon by contributing code, documentation, or use cases.

🚀 Get started today and bring AI-powered insights to your geospatial data!

docs.title: common module
docs.text: The common module contains common functions and classes used by the other modules.

docs.title: hello_world()
docs.text:
Prints "Hello World!" to the console.

Source code in maeson/common.py 
def hello_world():
    """Prints "Hello World!" to the console."""
    print("Hello World!")

docs.title: Contributing to MAESon 🤝🚀
docs.text: Thank you for your interest in contributing to MAESon! We welcome contributions of all kinds, including bug fixes, new features, documentation improvements, and discussions.

docs.title: 1. Fork the Repository
docs.text:
Click the Fork button at the top of the MAESon GitHub repository, and clone it to your local machine: 

git clone https://github.com/yourusername/MAESon.git
cd MAESon

docs.title: 2. Create a Branch
docs.text:
Create a new branch for your feature or bug fix: 

git checkout -b feature-xyz

docs.title: 3. Install Dependencies
docs.text:
Ensure you have all necessary dependencies installed: 

pip install -r requirements.txt
For development, install additional dependencies: 
pip install -r requirements-dev.txt

docs.title: 4. Make Your Changes
docs.text: Modify the codebase and test your changes. If adding a new feature, update the documentation accordingly.

docs.title: 5. Run Tests ✅
docs.text:
Ensure all tests pass before submitting a pull request: 

pytest

docs.title: 6. Commit and Push Changes
docs.text:
git add .
git commit -m "Add feature XYZ"
git push origin feature-xyz

docs.title: 7. Submit a Pull Request
docs.text: Go to the MAESon repository on GitHub, navigate to the Pull Requests tab, and submit a new pull request. Provide a clear description of the changes you've made.

docs.title: Reporting Issues 🐞
docs.text: If you encounter a bug, please report it by opening an issue on GitHub Issues. Provide as much detail as possible, including: - Steps to reproduce the issue - Expected behavior - Actual behavior - Screenshots or error logs (if applicable)

docs.title: Code Style Guidelines ✨
docs.text:
• Follow PEP 8 for Python code style.
  • Use type hints where applicable.
  • Write docstrings for all functions and classes.

docs.title: Documentation Contributions 📖
docs.text: We also welcome contributions to our documentation! If you'd like to improve or add new sections, edit the markdown files in the docs/ directory and submit a pull request.

docs.title: Join the Discussion 💬
docs.text:
Want to discuss a feature before implementing it? Join the Discussions tab or open an issue to propose new ideas!

🚀 Thank you for contributing to MAESon! Your support helps make geospatial AI more accessible and powerful.

docs.title: Installation Guide for MAESon 📦🚀
docs.text: MAESon is available on PyPI, making it easy to install and use. Follow the steps below to set up MAESon on your system.

docs.title: Prerequisites 🛠
docs.text: Before installing MAESon, ensure you have the following: - Python 3.8+ installed on your system - pip (Python package manager) updated to the latest version - Recommended: A virtual environment (e.g., venv or conda) for package management

docs.title: 1. Install via PyPI
docs.text:
To install the latest stable release of MAESon, run: 

pip install maeson

docs.title: 2. Verify Installation
docs.text:
To check if MAESon was installed successfully, run: 

import maeson
print(maeson.__version__)
This should return the installed version of MAESon.

docs.title: 3. Optional: Install Additional Dependencies
docs.text:
If you plan to use advanced features such as deep learning models or high-performance processing, install additional dependencies: 

pip install maeson[full]

docs.title: Upgrading MAESon 🔄
docs.text:
To update MAESon to the latest version, use: 

pip install --upgrade maeson

docs.title: Uninstalling MAESon ❌
docs.text:
If you need to remove MAESon from your system, run: 

pip uninstall maeson

docs.title: Troubleshooting ❓
docs.text:
If you encounter any issues: - Ensure pip and setuptools are up to date: 

pip install --upgrade pip setuptools
- Check for missing dependencies and install them manually. - Report issues on GitHub Issues.

🚀 You're now ready to use MAESon! Head over to the User Guide to get started.

docs.text: Main module.

docs.title: Usage
docs.text:
To use maeson in a project:

import maeson
